intro: Erigeron hieracioides, commonly known as yarrowleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has fine, hairy leaves and produces small, white to pale blue flowers. Erigeron hieracioides is often found in the western United States and is adapted to arid environments.
